Package zuul.gameState

Class Room

java.lang.Object
zuul.gameState.Room
public class Room
extends java.lang.Object
A room in the "World of Zuul" application. This represents one location in the scenery of the game. It is connected to other rooms via exits. For each exit direction, the room stores a reference to the neighboring room. The room has an inventory that can store items. The room stores a list of Characters it contains.

  • Constructor Details

    • Room

      public Room​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description)
      Creates a room with name "name" and described "description". This room does not contain exits, Items or Characters.

      "description" is something like "a kitchen" or "an open court yard".

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the room, not null
      description - the room's description, not null

  • Method Details

    • setExits

      public void setExits​(java.lang.String[] directions, Room[] rooms)
      Defines the exits of this room.

      Every direction must lead to another room. Only the first exit will be added for each unique direction name.

      Parameters:
      directions - the set of exit directions, not null
      rooms - the set of rooms lead to by the exit directions, not null

    • addExit

      public void addExit​(java.lang.String direction, Room room)
      Ensures that the specified exit is part of this Room's state.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction of the exit, not null
      room - the room the exit leads to, not null

    • getDescription

      public java.lang.String getDescription()
      Gets the description of this room.
      Returns:
      the description of this room, not null

    • getCharacters

      public java.util.ArrayList<Character> getCharacters()
      Gets a shallow copy of the list of each Character in the room.

      Only a shallow copy is performed so that Characters are not duplicated.

      Returns:
      the list characters currently in the room, not null

    • getCharacter

      public java.util.Optional<Character> getCharacter​(java.lang.String name)
      Gets the Character specified by name if it is in this room.

      Always returns

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the character to find, not null
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the Character with the name specified if found in this room's state, an empty optional otherwise, not null

    • getExit

      public java.util.Optional<Room> getExit​(java.lang.String exit)
      Gets the Room in the direction specified if there is an exit in that direction in this room.
      Parameters:
      exit - the direction of exit from this room to retrieve the corresponding room for
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the room in direction exit or null if it doesn't exist

    • printInfo

      public void printInfo()
      Prints the state of this room.

      The state of this room includes the description, exits, and Inventory of this Room.

    • addCharacter

      public void addCharacter​(Character character)
      Ensures that the specified Character is part of this Room's state.
      Parameters:
      character - the Character to ensure is in this room

    • removeCharacter

      public void removeCharacter​(Character character)
      Removes a Character from this room.
      Parameters:
      character - The character to remove.

    • getInventory

      public Inventory getInventory()
      Gets the Inventory of this Room.

      It is returned directly so that it can be modified without Item duplication.

      Returns:
      this Room's Inventory

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
      Indicates if the given object reference is "equal to" this Room using name.

      The given object reference is considered "equal to" this if it:

      • is a reference to the same object
      or
      • is an instance of Room, and
      • o.name equals this.name
      (Method automatically generated by IntelliJ Idea.)
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      o - the object to compare to this
      Returns:
      true if o == this or o is a Room and o.name equals this.name, false otherwise
